message.content:
cs.CL, cs.SI, cs.SD, cs.CY, cs.CR

This paper deals with the annotation and identification of antisemitic content in large datasets, which involves natural language processing and machine learning techniques. Therefore, it is most likely to belong to the Computational Linguistics (cs.CL) sub-category. However, it also involves social media analysis, data mining, and information retrieval, which are relevant to the Social and Information Networks (cs.SI), Software Engineering (cs.SE), and Cybersecurity (cs.CR) sub-categories. Additionally, the paper discusses the challenges of finding a consistent way to identify diverse manifestations of antisemitism in large datasets, which is related to the Statistical Learning (cs.SD) sub-category. Finally, the paper discusses the need for a clear definition of antisemitism, which is relevant to the Cybersecurity (cs.CY) sub-category.
